fields.headline: Get-rich quick guide for graduates
fields.bodyText:  Pay your biggest debts first. Credit and store cards make borrowing too easy and charge high rates.  Tell your creditors when you move home or they may tire of writing to you for money and take legal action.  Resist offers to consolidate your student loan into another, dearer one. The original loans, pegged to inflation, are a very good deal.  Talk to your creditors if you have difficulty meeting your repayments. They may offer a compromise deal.  Build an emergency fund of up to three months' pay.  Know yourself: if you fear overspending, you should shun credit cards; if you are cautious, make repaying debt a priority; if you are reckless, consider savings and investments.  Check the banks' graduate deals, including cheap loans. Click here for some useful information.  Don't always assume your parents are right about money. Many older people see borrowing as a first step to hell, but their children and grandchildren are more flexible.  You must know by now how much money landlords make. So, if you can afford it, consider investing in property.  Remember your skills are in demand. Think big and approach potential employers with enthusiasm - a £25K salary is just around the corner
